text:
Q: Why we need a master branch in Git-flow? A:

Well, first, you need to merge into it. In most cases that should go without conflicts, but still. Also, either we test release branch and then re-test the merged master branch (if we are going to use it for deployment), or we merge and only then test, or we don't use master for deployment at all. In first case, it's extra efforts for extra branch; second case looks different from git-flow where each chart says "bugfixes on the release branch" (besides, new release gets merged into master even before it's actually tested and released, and that actually breaks the rule that master only contains actually released releases); and in the last case, it's even more "why have it then?" - only for one benefit of having some place where all released branch are listed in chronological order?

Q: Can the Mac file-picker filter by the whole file name? A:

How do you run the file picker? Document based app? SwiftUI? NSOpenPanel?

Q: SQLAlchemy with asyncpg cannot perform operation: another operation is in progress A:

For me TaskGroup saved the day for some reason.

From this:

async with session_maker() as async_session:
    report_repo: ReportRepo = await get_report_repo(db_session=async_session)

    result_1, result_2 = await asyncio.gather(
            report_repo.get_result(1),
            report_repo.get_result(2),
    )

To this:

async with session_maker() as async_session:
    report_repo: ReportRepo = await get_report_repo(db_session=async_session)
    
    async with asyncio.TaskGroup() as tg:
        result_1_task = tg.create_task(report_repo.get_result(1))
        result_2_task = tg.create_task(report_repo.get_result(2))

    result_1 = await result_1_task
    result_2 = await reuslt_2_task

Q: Permission problem in android application with VS 2022 A:

It seems that There is no relations between Manifest permissions and app setting permissions in device .The problem was from SDK not permissions

Q: How to read array line in sequence from input file? A:

You are iterating over all your sites and then (for each site) add the domain to the current site.

In pseudocode this is:

foreach site
    foreach domain
       print site + domain

Swap your loops so that the logic is

foreach domain
    foreach site
        print site + domain

Note that this is pseudocode, not Perl.

In "real" Perl this would look like:

#!/usr/bin/env perl

use strict;
use warnings;

my $file = 'sites.txt';
open( my $fh, '<:encoding(UTF-8)', $file )
  or die "Couldn't open file !'$file' $!";

my @rows = <$fh>;
chomp @rows;

my @domains = qw(.com .net .org);

foreach my $dns (@domains) {
    foreach my $site (@rows) {
        print "$site$dns\n";
    }
}

Output

site1.com
site2.com
site3.com
site1.net
site2.net
site3.net
site1.org
site2.org
site3.org

Please always include use strict; and use warnings; on top of your scripts. These two statements will show you the most common errors in your code.
